updates.canonical_current: Reframed as a human relationship system based on collective contribution and distribution according to need
updates.chapter_contribution: Introduction provides the clearest formulation: 'from each according to their ability, to each according to their need — the default logic of a healthy family'
updates.proposed_merge: Add formulation: 'The default logic of a healthy family'

updates.canonical_current: Reframed as a powerful engine for discovering and generating value
updates.chapter_contribution: Introduction provides explicit formulation: 'market-driven specialization and exchange that generate surplus — the engine that makes room for experimentation, innovation, and generosity'
updates.proposed_merge: Add to book_usage: 'The engine that makes room for experimentation, innovation, and generosity'

updates.canonical_current: Reframed positively as appropriate for friendships and informal networks
updates.chapter_contribution: Introduction provides explicit formulation: 'from voluntary cooperation to complex self-adapting natural systems — the logic of friendships, volunteer networks, and other forms of emergent order'
updates.proposed_merge: Add to examples: 'volunteer networks' as explicit anarchy habitat instance

updates.canonical_current: The mistake of prioritizing a system that works well in one habitat at a different scale
updates.chapter_contribution: Introduction provides four scale error examples: 'We try to run families like corporations. We try to run markets like families. We try to run nations like a tight-knit tribe. We try to police friendships.'
updates.proposed_merge: Add examples: 'Families like corporations, markets like families, nations like tribes, policed friendships'

updates.canonical_current: The real-world conditions and contexts in which humans operate within the framework of one of the four systems
updates.chapter_contribution: Introduction uses 'proper habitat' language: 'coordination logics that work beautifully in their proper habitat'
updates.proposed_merge: Add note: 'Proper habitat' = context where a system's logic works beautifully

additions.definition: The tools, land, code, and machines that enable economic production - acknowledged as important but positioned as 'downstream' of more basic coordination patterns
additions.book_usage: Explicitly deprioritized: 'Those debates matter. I'm just convinced they're downstream of something more basic: the ways humans coordinate at different scales of life.'
additions.why_new: Explicit positioning of ownership debates as secondary to coordination logic
relates_to_canonical: System of Systems of Human Relationship Phenomena

additions.definition: The book's self-description as 'a field guide, not a spreadsheet' - emphasizing practical pattern recognition over abstract theory or data
additions.purpose: Sets expectations: stories first, then map, then failure modes. Practical application over academic analysis.
additions.methodology: Stories → Map → Failure modes, stealing insights from history, economics, and moral philosophy
additions.why_new: Establishes the book's genre and approach

additions.definition: The explicit promise that the book will disappoint readers seeking partisan ammunition: 'The world is too weird for that. The goal here isn't to win arguments — it's to get the map right enough that we can stop driving into the same ditch.'
additions.purpose: Positions the book as transcending left/right partisan warfare
additions.why_new: Establishes authorial stance and reader expectations
